solution_line_template: He saved money for {years_saved} years, which is equal to {months_per_year} x {years_saved} = <<{months_per_year}*{years_saved}={total_months_saved}>>{total_months_saved} months.
The amount of money he saved is ${monthly_deposit}*{total_months_saved} = $<<{monthly_deposit}*{total_months_saved}={total_saved_money}>>{total_saved_money}.
But he spent some money so there is ${total_saved_money} - ${spent_on_car_repair} = <<{total_saved_money}-{spent_on_car_repair}={money_left}>>{money_left} left.
